intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to configure StatET to launch an R console from within Eclipse.
Note that the R console in StatET requires the R package 'rj'. Please check the homepage for more information and installation instructions.
In StatET you have to create a configuration for the R environment and the R console as shown here.

item.title: Add R Environment
item.description: To add an R environment to StatET, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Clicking on the 'Add...' button opens the dialog to specify the new R environment.
Indicate a 'Name' you would like to give to the configuration, e.g. 'R-2.13'.
Specify the 'R_HOME' directory to which the R version you would like to use was installed.
Click the 'Detect Default Properties/Settings' button to load the default values for the other options.
Click on 'OK' to close the dialog.
Click on 'OK' to save the new R environment and close the preferences dialog.

item.title: R Console Launch Configuration
item.description: Next, you need a launch configuration for the R console:

subitem.label: Double-click on 'R Console' to create a new configuration.
Specify a 'Name' and edit all tabs of the new launch configuration.
Add suitable Options in the Main tab if desired, such as --no-save or --no-restore, to be used when invoking R.
Specify the R Environment to be used in the R Config tab. This can be the default R Environment or any other R Environment that has been defined.
Optionally check the box in the Common tab to list this R Launch configuration in the Favorites menu
Click on 'Apply' to save the R Launch Configuration

item.title: Launch the R console
item.description:
Click on 'Run' in the Run Dialog for the R Launch configuration you created.
The R Console will be launched and ready for use from within Eclipse.
